author: etan_status
content:
In EIP-6493, for EL only `StableContainer` is exchanged on the network, while the individual `Variant` are used for type safety within implementations.

For consensus data structures, the fork schedule determines which `Variant` is valid at any given time, e.g., there is only a single `BeaconState` variant valid for any given network topic. That's why I've promoted `Variant` to not be just for internal use, but also be exchangable over the network. 

So, in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7495, now:
- `StableContainer`: forward-compatible merkleization and serialization
- `Variant`: forward-compatible merkleization (same as `StableContainer`), but compact type dependent serialization (similar to `Container`)

This enables to also use `StableContainer` in consensus without serialization overhead: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8439/files
Transitioning consensus data structures to forward-compatible merkleization is good for applications that consume consensus merkle proofs, e.g., decentralized staking pools
